intro: Cyathea sulitii, commonly known as the Mindanao tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically bright green and can be used for ornamental purposes in gardens. Cyathea sulitii plays a significant role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability in its native habitat.
